content: I must say I’m divided. I can understand your frustration but I also know that UX is (or supposed to be) focused on users. There is a bunch of times that we, as creators, have to step back in a certain product, idea or concept because users (or even the market) aren’t ready for it. This is really important but I can’t help to thing how user experience and design can have an educational role in societies. Quoting the classic (and quite often quoted) Ford’s saying “If I had asked people what they wanted, they would have said faster horses.” When user experience starts to be one of the responsible and generator for society values, maturity and education, we’ll have really challenging issues to solve.
